result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul F. Cleereman Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Paul F. Cleereman Jr.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: If revoked, defendant may serve jail time under Huber law and is eligable for community service.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol or any illegal drugs, not to enter any bars or taverns.
Take all medications as prescribed by medical doctor.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul F. Cleereman in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:42 PM. Burns - Cts 1 & 2 amend to misd bail jumping, count 3 would be DRI. Place on probation for 2 years with conditions of court costs on each count. cts 1 & 2   Imposed and stayed - 9 months jail term, consecutive. Probation conditions - AODA, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, full time emp/schooling, 150 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by medical doctor. Court DRI count 3. Court amends count 1 to misd. bail jumping, 946.49(1)(a). Defendant pleads NC to amended charge. Court amends Ct 2 amended to misd. bail jumping 946.49(1)(a) - defendant pleads NC to amended charge. Court goes over PLQ and finds the defendant is entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently, waives his right to trial, finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State makes final statement and asks to follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final statement and asks to adopt joint recommendation, 20 days jail credit (stipulated) if revoked. Cleereman makes statement, remorseful. Defendant's father makes statement. Court will accept joint recommendation and  sentences to the following: Counts 1 & 2 Impose and stay sentence, 9 months on each count, consecutive to count 1. Place on probation for 2 years with conditions of court costs on each count, AODA and follow through with all recommendations, no possession or consumption of alcohol or of any illegal drugs, no entry into bars and taverns, full time employment, 150 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by medical doctor, attend one AA/NA meeting per week, 20 days jail credit if revoked. If revoked, jail time can be served under Huber law and eligable for community service. Post conviction rights given.

Defendant Paul F. Cleereman in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:10 PM. State - in anticipation of a waiver of PH, has filed an Information that mirrors the complaint. Burns and Cleereman agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Burns has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul F. Cleereman in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Paul F. Cleereman in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:05 AM. On 15CF153 - waives reading of complaint, requests PH and will waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, set for PH. State - bond - $2000.00 signature bond. Burns - no objections. Court - $2000.00 signature bond. State - on 15CF112 - amend #2 to county ordinance of DC and plead to amended count #2 with fine of $300 plus costs, plead G/NC to counts #1 and #3 as alleged, court costs on each count, #1 - 30 days in FC jail, #3 - 90 days in FC jail - consecutive to count #1, #4 - DRI; 15CF125 - amend count #2 and #3 to misd bail jumpings each - plead to amended counts #2 and #3, #1 - DRI, probation for 2 years - consecutive to jail time on 15CF112, conditions of court costs, AODA and follow thru, 200 hours of community service, any other conditions as deemed appropriate by P&P. State mentions to Court and Burns that the defendant's mother has asked that a condition be added of no entry into the bar of his mother or the premises. Burns and Cleereman agree. Court - 15CF112 - amends count #2 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, forfeiture of $300.00 plus costs totalling $582.50 - due at rate of $50.00/month commencing on the first day of the month following release from incarceration. Cleerman pleads NC to counts #1 and #3, court dismisses and reads in count #4. Court - on 15CF125 - court amends counts #2 and #3 to misd bail jumping - reads new charge and penalty. Cleereman pleads NC to counts #2 and #3 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in count #1. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendations - credit for 42 days. Cleereman withholds comment. Court sentences the defendnat to the following: 15CF112 - count #1 - costs - add to payment plan, 30 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 22 days; count #3 - 90 days in FC jail - consecutive to count #1 - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), costs - add to payment plan; 15CF125 - counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - consecutive to jail time on 15CF112 - with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, costs on each count - paid thru probation, 200 hours of community service (total), seek anger management or similar treatment and follow thru, obtain/maintain full time employment/school, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, attend at least on AA meeting each week and provide proof of attendance to P&P, any other conditions as deemed appropriate by P&P, gives ramifications of not complying and/or successfully completing probation and may impose jail time, submit DNA sample and gave expungement collaquey, right to appeal, adjourned.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
